channel.title: s33g
channel.description: A developer blog with ASCII aesthetics

item.title: The Navigation API: the end of routing hacks
item.description: The browser finally has a dedicated API for SPA navigation.

item.title: I'm Tired of the AI Doom and Gloom — Here's Why I'm Still Excited
item.description: Every time I open LinkedIn or Reddit, someone's declaring the end of software engineering. But the doom narrative misses the point entirely.

item.title: Shipping Units: Discovery to Deploy with AI
item.description: A modern unit converter built with Next.js, Perplexity, and Gemini 3 Pro. From initial spark to production deployment.

item.title: Thriving in tech's AI era
item.description: Doing everything right and still uncertain. Why the "AI will replace us" narrative misses the point—and what actually matters.

item.title: YSX: A Delightfully Weird React Experiment
item.description: A build-time transpiler experiment that lets you write React components in pure YAML format.

item.title: Introducing: GrooveLab
item.description: How I rebranded a personal music utility while experimenting with generative AI in my programming workflow.

item.title: BPM Tool: tempo math for music producers
item.description: A web calculator for BPM to ms/Hz, plus swing, groove, MIDI export, and a tiny synth to audition feel.

item.title: Better ASCII animations with WebGL
item.description: Canvas 2D got me a working ASCII background, but WebGL2 is what made it smooth at real viewport sizes.

item.title: GitHub Fork Manager: cleaning up forks without the pain
item.description: A fast, terminal-first tool to delete forks (or repos) safely at scale, with guardrails and logs.

item.title: Building a dev blog with ASCII art and AI
item.description: How I built this site using Astro, TypeScript, and some help from AI assistants. A story of ASCII art, explosions, and chasing aesthetic.

item.title: Introducing `proj` a portable project navigator
item.description: A fast TUI that scans your code folders, gives quick context, and lets you trigger common project actions from the terminal.

item.title: 2026: write more.
item.description: A quiet resolution to ship writing, share my work, and keep things focused.
